contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Harriett Moore small.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Harriet Jane Moore c. 1860s]] [[Image:M Faraday Lab H Moore.jpg|thumb|200px|right|''Michael Faraday in his laboratory.'' c. 1850s by Harriet Moore]] [[Image:Royal Institution - Michael Faraday's study.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Michael Faraday's Study on the second floor at The Royal Institution, 1850–55]] '''Harriet Jane Moore''' (1801–1884) was a British watercolour artist who is remembered for her drawings of [[Michael Faraday]]'s work at the [[Royal Institution]]. She documented his apartment, study, and laboratory in a series of watercolour paintings in the early 1850s. Letters between Faraday and Moore survive at the [[Institution of Engineering and Technology]]. She was the daughter of James Carrick Moore (1762–1840) and Harriet Henderson (1779–1866), the eldest of 5 children. She was the niece of [[John Moore (British Army officer)|Sir John Moore]] the British army general in the [[Peninsular war]]. ==References== *[http://www.rhs.ac.uk/bibl/wwwopac.exe?database=crossref&rf=200209147 Royal Historical Society Bibliography - Record details] Giving date of death. Accessed July 2008 *[http://www.jjhc.info/moorejamescarrick1860.htm Genealogy of the Moore family] Showing details of her parents and siblings. At JJ Heath-Caldwell family history. Accessed July 2008. *[http://www.bridgeman.co.uk/search/view_image2.asp?image_id=136899 Early 1860s (albumen print) photograph of Harriet Moore] At Bridgeman Art Library. Accessed July 2008. *[http://www.theiet.org/about/libarc/archives/exhibition/faraday/artists.cfm Images of letters between Faraday and Moore] at The Institution of Engineering and Technology. Accessed July 2008 *[http://www.artchive.com/web_gallery/H/Harriet-Jane-Moore/Harriet-Jane-Moore-reproductions-1.html Harriet Jane Moore gallery at archive.com] Accessed February 2010. ==External links== {{commons|Harriet Moore}} *[http://www.myartprints.com/a/moore-harriet-jane.html Prints by Harriet Moore] at myartprints.com . Accessed July 2008 *[http://www.artchive.com/web_gallery/H/Harriet-Jane-Moore/Sergeant-Anderson-in-the-Basement-Laboratory-1852.html Sergeant Anderson in the Basement Laboratory, 1852 (w/c on paper)] Print at Europicture.
